s1: This course teaches introductory programming within a problem solving framework applicable to the sciences.
s2: This course aims to provide students with sufficient knowledge of the basic principles of software project management that they may support a project manager to carry out the project administrative functions of a program office, understand leadership and management within the context of an agile project development team, and understand the context in which project management is conducted.

s1: The course emphasises technical programming, the simulation of scientific systems and the processing of scientific data.
s2: This course aims to provide students with sufficient knowledge of the basic principles of software project management that they may support a project manager to carry out the project administrative functions of a program office, understand leadership and management within the context of an agile project development team, and understand the context in which project management is conducted.

s1: There is an emphasis on designing and writing correct code.
s2: Many of the skills gained are of use outside formal project management environments.

s1: Testing and debugging are seen as integral to the programming enterprise.
s2: Evaluate the features of traditional and agile approaches to managing software development to decide an appropriate project management approach for a project in a business context.

s1: Both top-down and object oriented design are taught.
s2: Evaluate the features of traditional and agile approaches to managing software development to decide an appropriate project management approach for a project in a business context.

s1: There will be an introduction to widely-used computer science algorithms and to machine architecture.
s2: Many of the skills gained are of use outside formal project management environments.

s1: The course will be taught using one or more programming languages which are widely applicable to scientific work.
s2: Many of the skills gained are of use outside formal project management environments.

s1: Design, write and debug small programs to solve practical problems of a scientific nature.
s2: This course aims to provide students with sufficient knowledge of the basic principles of software project management that they may support a project manager to carry out the project administrative functions of a program office, understand leadership and management within the context of an agile project development team, and understand the context in which project management is conducted.

s1: Have a practical understanding of the processing of scientific data.
s2: Many of the skills gained are of use outside formal project management environments.

s1: Be able to describe and design small computer programs using both procedural and object-oriented methodologies.
s2: Evaluate the features of traditional and agile approaches to managing software development to decide an appropriate project management approach for a project in a business context.

s1: Have an awareness of good program organisation.
Have an understanding of some widely-used algorithms.
s2: Many of the skills gained are of use outside formal project management environments.

s1: Have an understanding of practical aspects of machine architecture including finite precision and rounding errors.
s2: Many of the skills gained are of use outside formal project management environments.
